node.title: Majority of Britons want to continue working from home - survey finds
node.description: Only one in three workers want to never work from home.
node.content: ["The majority of Britons want to continue working from home after COVID-19, a new survey has found.\u00a0", "A poll carried out by YouGov on behalf of The Times found 57 percent of British workers want to be able to work from home.\u00a0", "Of those 37 percent want to work from home some of the time and 20 percent want to work from home full time.\u00a0", "Additionally only one in three workers (37 percent) say they want to continue never working from home.", "The survey found of workers who are currently working from home, 72 percent think it's very or fairly likely they will be allowed to continue working remotely.\u00a0", "And it seems working from home is seen as an opportunity for some people to move out of expensive cities.", "Overall 20 percent of workers surveyed say they would consider \"moving to a different area of the country that is not within commuting distance of my company\u2019s workplace\". That includes 7 to 12 percent who say they would \"strongly\" consider moving far away from their office.\u00a0\n", "But it seems Kiwis are feeling fatigued from working from home. Consultants JLL's office sentiment survey showed Kiwis still want to go into the workplace, with only 2 percent of people wanting to work exclusively from home.\u00a0", "Additionally, 58 percent of workers want to return to the office part-time or full time despite the risk of catching COVID-19.\u00a0", "It comes after New Zealand was once again plunged into the red traffic light setting amidst Omicron spreading in the community.\u00a0", "While offices can remain open in red, many employers urge staff to work from home if they can.\u00a0", "On Saturday there were 97 new community COVID-19 cases and 11 Omicron infections.\u00a0\u00a0"]
